title: Who is Shailaja Paik, the Dalit scholar who was awarded Rs 67 lakh MacArthur 'genius' grant?
title_detail_value: Who is Shailaja Paik, the Dalit scholar who was awarded Rs 67 lakh MacArthur 'genius' grant?
summary: India-born historian and author Shailaja Paik became the first Dalit scholar to be awarded the coveted MacArthur Fellowship, often called the ‘genius grant.’ The 50-year-old history professor recognised for her pioneering work in Dalit studies, gender, and sexuality in modern India, will receive an impressive $800,000 (approximately Rs 67 lakh) to support her ongoing research

title: The alarming rise of anti-Dalit violence and discrimination in India: A series of gruesome incidents since July 2024
title_detail_value: The alarming rise of anti-Dalit violence and discrimination in India: A series of gruesome incidents since July 2024
summary: India has long struggled with deep-rooted caste-based discrimination that permeates into various aspects of society. Despite constitutional safeguards and legal protections, Dalits in India continue to face systemic violence, discrimination, and social exclusion. Recent incidents across the country highlight a grim reality where Dalit lives are often undervalued, leading to a surge in brutal attacks,…

title: 12 years on, Dalit Survivors of Andhra Pradesh's Laxmipeta Massacre Await Justice
title_detail_value: 12 years on, Dalit Survivors of Andhra Pradesh's Laxmipeta Massacre Await Justice
summary: The bloody incident claimed the lives of five Dalit men and left over 40 people severely injured. The scale of violence unleashed in Laxmipeta was on par with Karamchedu (1985) and Tsunduru (1991) caste atrocities, which rocked the then undivided Andhra Pradesh.
